stem: Given question: Returning to work was easy for Dan.  He had liked doing nothing for weeks, and after his treatment he was complately what? and answer: painless, explain why in
no_more_50_words: The question insinuates that Dan was away from work on medical leave, since he had a treatment during this time. One common reason to have a medical treatment is to relieve pain.
50_to_100_words: It is likely that Dan had been going through some form of treatment or therapy that had been causing him pain. After the treatment, he no longer experienced any pain, which made returning to work easy for him. The phrase "complately painless" means that he has no pain or discomfort anymore. This phrase is indicating that after a period of time where he had discomfort, he is now in a much better state, and is not feeling any pain. This can make returning to work easier as he is not dealing with the added stress and discomfort of pain.
